snippet: For Massachusetts officials used to the glad-handing of local politics, Mitt Romney was an unfamiliar breed. His approach could offer hints of how a possible President Romney might deal with Congress.
abstract: Massachusetts lawmakers say that Mitt Romney's aloof manner and lack of personal warmth was apparent during his tenure as governor; Romney's oppositional relationship with the state legislature, and his technocratic style as a governor, could prefigure his relationship with Congress should he become president. (Series: The Long Run)

byline.contributor: Ashley Southall and Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: For Massachusetts officials used to the glad-handing of local politics, Mitt Romney was an unfamiliar breed. His approach could offer hints of how a possible President Romney might deal with Congress.

headline.print_headline: Legislators Recall Governor Who Didn’t Mingle
headline.seo: Romney’s C.E.O. Style in Massachusetts Could Irk Lawmakers
headline.main: Legislators Recall Governor Who Didn’t Mingle
